conclusion: Analyze the flow paths from points A, B, and C to determine which container the liquid will flow into.
Liquid from A encounters a brown baffle that directs it to the right.
Liquid from A continues to flow right and then downward.
Liquid from A reaches the bottom and flows into container D.
Liquid from B encounters a yellow baffle that directs it to the right.
Liquid from B continues to flow right and then downward.
Liquid from B reaches the bottom and flows into container D.
Liquid from C encounters a red baffle that directs it to the left.
Liquid from C continues to flow left and then downward.
Liquid from C reaches the bottom and flows into container E.
Liquid from points A and B flows into container D.
Liquid from point C flows into container E.
Final answer: Liquid from A and B will flow into container D, and liquid from C will flow into container E.
